item.title: Safari
item.description:
Safari is a graphical web browser developed by Apple and included as part of the Mac OS X operating system.

Platform: Windows / Mac

References: https://www.apple.com/safari/ https://zh.wikipedia.org/zh-tw/Safari
item.author: dio

item.title: Opera
item.description:
Opera is a web browser and Internet suite developed by Opera Software.

Platform: Linux / Windows / Mac /FreeBSD

References: https://www.opera.com/ https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opera
item.author: dio

item.title: Windows Phone
item.description:
Windows Phone, is a compact mobile operating system developed by Microsoft, and designed for use in smartphones and mobile devices.

Platform: Windows Phone

References: https://www.microsoft.com/windowsmobile/en-us/default.mspx
item.author: dio

item.title: iOS
item.description:
*iOS (known as iPhone OS prior to June 2010) is Apple's mobile operating system. Originally developed for the iPhone, it has since been extended to support other Apple devices such as the iPod touch, iPad and Apple TV. Apple does not license iOS for installation on third-party hardware.

Platform: iOS

References: https://zh.wikipedia.org/zh-tw/IOS
item.author: dio

item.title: Google Chrome
item.description:
Google Chrome is a web browser developed by Google that uses the WebKit layout engine and application framework.

Platform: Linux / Windows / Mac

References: https://www.google.com/chrome https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_Chrome
item.author: dio

item.title: Mozilla Firefox
item.description:
Mozilla Firefox is a free and open source web browser descended from the Mozilla Application Suite and managed by Mozilla Corporation.

Platform: Linux / Windows / Mac

References: https://www.mozilla.com/en-US/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mozilla_Firefox
item.author: dio

item.title: Internet Explorer
item.description:
Windows Internet Explorer (formerly Microsoft Internet Explorer; abbreviated to MSIE or, more commonly, IE), is a series of graphical web browsers developed by Microsoft

Platform: Windows

References: https://www.microsoft.com/windows/internet-explorer/default.aspx https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Explorer
item.author: dio

item.title: Zonbu
item.description:
Zonbu is a technology company that sells a computing platform which combines a web-centric service, a small form factor PC, and an open source based software architecture.

Platform: Zonbu hybrid OS

References: https://www.zonbu.com/home/index.htm https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zonbu
item.author: dio

item.title: Wyse
item.description:
Wyse Technology is the global leader in Cloud Client Computing. The Wyse portfolio includes industry-leading thin, zero and cloud PC client solutions with advanced management, desktop virtualization and cloud software supporting desktops, laptops and next generation mobile devices.

References: https://www.wyse.com/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wyse
item.author: dio

item.title: Cherrypal
item.description:
Cherrypal Corporation, www.cherrypal.com, known for its high quality, low-power consuming and inexpensive laptop computers.

References: https://www.cherrypal.com/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CherryPal
item.author: dio
